Package main.java.progOO2.p07

package main.java.progOO2.p07

Programming Object Oriented II: Product

This package reinforces object-oriented programming (OOP) concepts by combining a constructor with parameters and a method to display object data. It models a real-world object: a product in a store.

Key learning goals:

  • Parameterized constructor: The Product class uses a constructor to initialize multiple attributes: name, price, and quantity.
  • Multiple fields: This class includes several private fields to represent the state of a product, supporting the idea of more complex data modeling.
  • Encapsulation: The attributes are declared private, reinforcing data protection and preparation for future accessor methods.
  • Printing object state: The printProduct() method introduces how to output an object's internal state in a user-friendly format.

This exercise connects class structure to practical applications like inventory or store systems, and prepares students for more advanced object manipulation.

Note: The Product class may be extended later with methods to update price or quantity, or to support user interaction.
